summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing preparations for a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, as required by the Department of Justice's settlement in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) litigation. The correspondence focuses on updating victim contact lists and coordinating FBI participation to avoid substantive discussions during the meeting.

persons.name: Bekah
persons.context: Mentioned as being in touch with ODAG to coordinate the victim meeting and having shared lessons from previous victim meetings.

persons.name: Stacie
persons.context: Suggested to reach out to the FBI victim services coordinator to update the victim list.

persons.name: John
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the email author is happy to raise issues with directly regarding FBI participation in the victim meeting.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Mentioned alongside John as someone the email author is happy to raise issues with directly regarding FBI participation in the victim meeting.

events.title: Nolle Prosequi Proceeding
events.description: Reference to a 'nolle proceeding' from the previous August (2019), which appears to be when a list of victims was initially sent to ODAG.

events.title: Planned DOJ Victim Meeting
events.description: A meeting with victims required by the DOJ's settlement in the CVRA litigation, planned to occur in DC in the next 3-4 weeks from the email date. Its purpose is to explain and review the findings of OPR's investigation.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Department of Justice (DOJ) is organizing a meeting with Epstein victims as part of its settlement in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) litigation.
The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) has conducted an investigation related to the Epstein case, and the meeting's purpose is to review its findings with victims.
Prosecutors are taking steps to minimize the likelihood of substantive victim statements or interactions during the planned meeting, offering private FBI agent meetings instead.
The email references a previous 'nolle proceeding' from August 2019, indicating ongoing legal and victim coordination efforts over at least a year.
The correspondence highlights coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General), OPR, and FBI victim services.
